The team staged a kidnapping for N8 and Cyrus points out that famous paintings rapidly increase in value after being stolen and he says that his crew stole the Van Gogh painting and sold it in the black market for $20 million to buy N8 NFTs. They undertake two simultaneous thefts, stealing a Van Gogh painting in London while staging the fake kidnapping of renowned NFT artist N8 (Jacob Batalon) in Venice. Mi-Sun says that the chances of turning on the signal Jammer on the A-380 and the transponder on the private jet (to mimic the A-380's signal) are next to zero. Magnus escapes on the ground, while the remaining three are taken aboard the Molsen jet with the gold, headed for Jorgenson's estate in Tuscany. Harry agrees to help Cyrus against a payment of a million dollars. Once complete, the NFT will have captured the moment of its sale, which will include the buyer. Cyrus knows that Lars is a dangerous man and not to be trifled with, but Abby lures him in with an offer of full immunity for him and his entire crew, As part of the deal, Cyrus insists Abby join the team to provide certain cover for Interpol. Abby, Cyrus, and Camila are captured at gunpoint by Jorgenson, who also executes Leviathan's representative after they decide to cancel the deal. Their timing is complicated when Jorgenson executes a mole Arthur Tigue (Jess Liaudin) in his organization and moves up the delivery date. Cyrus argues that with Abby on the team Interpol will not hang the team out to dry if things do not go as per plan. Desperate for the gold to not reach Jorgenson, Huxley orders the plane shot down by NATO. Camila pilots the Molsen jet under the A-380, Abby assembles and turns on the signal Jammer on the A-380, while Camila turns on the transponder to mimic the A-380 signal. The NFT by N8 is made by a self portrait mask comprising of 482 cameras. Harry (David Proud), the crew's contact at air traffic control, works with Camila (who was piloting the Molsen jet) to get a message to the NATO fighter pilots that there are hostages on board the A-380, forcing them to stand down. Nevertheless, the crew is ready on time. Out of UK airspace, Brussels ATC will be tracking the flight, and Abby has a contact there who will help them. Camila puts the transponder on a drone headed to Zurich and follows the A-380 to Cortina. She resigns from Interpol and joins Cyrus. Now Huxley has a mole in Lars's organization named Arthur Tigue. Magnus, Abby, Cyrus, and Camila are captured. Jorgenson's henchmen (including Cormac (Burn Gorman) & Donal (Paul Anderson)) attempt a hijack, resulting in the plane crash landing at Cortina, followed by Camila landing the Molsen jet at the airport. It will be loaded onto a Sky Suisse A-380 passenger plane to Zurich. Another fight between the crew and Jorgenson's henchmen results in the jet crash landing on the grounds of Jorgenson's villa. The Carabinieri arrive, and Cyrus uses N8's NFT technology to show them a recording of Jorgenson murdering the representative. The gold weighs ten tons and will be delivered to Heathrow airport under armored cover. Rather than proceed with charges against the crew, Abby's superior, Commander Huxley (Sam Worthington), leverages their legal predicament to force them to help capture billionaire Lars Jorgenson (Jean Reno), who intends to make more money by working with the hacking group Leviathan to stage a massive flooding in Europe, allowing him to make billions in profit through stock manipulation. Cyrus (Kevin Hart), a renowned international thief, leads a heist crew that consists of Denton (Vincent D'Onofrio), pilot Camila (Ursula Corbero), hacker Mi-Sun (Kim Yoon-Ji), safe-cracker Magnus (Billy Magnussen), and engineer Luke (Viveik Kalra). Jorgenson is arrested, while Abby punches Huxley upon learning he authorized the NATO jets. She resigns from Interpol and joins Cyrus. Weeks later, Cyrus reveals to Abby that the crew stole the gold shipment during the heist on the airliner, replacing the actual shipment with iron bars painted to look like gold. The real gold shipment was parachuted out of the A-380 into the Swiss Alps while it was approaching the Cortina landing strip. Luke was never out; he guided the parachute to a recoverable spot in the mountains via remote control. Together, the crew recover their gold haul and celebrate their success while Cyrus and Abby kindle their relationship.

This mask will create the NFT, with a live 30-second feed from the auction itself. Once complete, the NFT will have captured the moment of its sale, which will include the buyer.

Interpol agent Abby Gladwell (Gugu Mbatha-Raw), a former fling of Cyrus, uncovers evidence implicating Denton, in the theft and arrests him. Denton was seen at the auction and Abby correctly deduced that his limp was a fake. Abby charges Denton with fraud since he participated in the auction and made a bid of more than $10 million, and he didn't have the funds to cover it.

Rather than proceed with charges against the crew, Abby's superior, Commander Huxley (Sam Worthington), leverages their legal predicament to force them to help capture billionaire Lars Jorgenson (Jean Reno), who intends to make more money by working with the hacking group Leviathan to stage a massive flooding in Europe, allowing him to make billions in profit through stock manipulation. Lars was responsible for making millions by shorting airlines stock, after the crash of a New Zealand plane that killed 189 people. So that makes him eligible for extradition to the US.

Now Huxley has a mole in Lars's organization named Arthur Tigue. As Leviathan requires payment of $500 million in untraceable gold bullion, Jorgenson has arranged for a shipment of gold to be taken from his vault in London and flown to Leviathan's bank in Zurich via a commercial airliner. The gold weighs ten tons and will be delivered to Heathrow airport under armored cover. It will be loaded onto a Sky Suisse A-380 passenger plane to Zurich. Huxley wants Cyrus and his crew to intercept this gold payment to Leviathan. Huxley cannot intercept the gold as it is a legal transaction.

Cyrus knows that Lars is a dangerous man and not to be trifled with, but Abby lures him in with an offer of full immunity for him and his entire crew. As part of the deal, Cyrus insists Abby join the team to provide certain cover for Interpol. Out of UK airspace, Brussels ATC will be tracking the flight, and Abby has a contact there who will help them. Harry (David Proud), the crew's contact at air traffic control, works with Camila (who was piloting the Molsen jet) to get a message to the NATO fighter pilots that there are hostages on board the A-380, forcing them to stand down. Harry agrees to help Cyrus against a payment of a million dollars.

Their timing is complicated when Jorgenson executes a mole Arthur Tigue (Jess Liaudin) in his organization and moves up the delivery date. Nevertheless, the crew is ready on time. openai/o3-mini-2025-01-31:
<PLOT_SUMMARY>  
Cyrus (Kevin Hart), a renowned international thief, leads a heist crew that consists of Denton (Vincent D'Onofrio), pilot Camila (Ursula Corbero), hacker Mi-Sun (Kim Yoon-Ji), safe‐cracker Magnus (Billy Magnussen), and engineer Luke (Viveik Kalra). When the mysterious hacking collective Leviathan demands payment of US $500 million in untraceable gold bullion, billionaire Lars Jorgenson (Jean Reno) arranges for a shipment to be flown from his London vault to Leviathan’s bank in Zurich on a commercial airliner. Although Huxley wants Cyrus and his crew to intercept the gold payment, the shipment is being transferred legally—and rather than press charges, Commander Huxley (Sam Worthington) forces the crew into helping capture Jorgenson, who has also been making millions by shorting airline stock after a tragic New Zealand crash that claimed 189 lives.  

Realizing that the only chance to steal the gold is while the airliner is mid‐air, the team crafts an audacious plan. They procure a private jet from a wealthy art collector named Molsen so that Camila can fly directly underneath the A-380, while Mi-Sun manipulates the radar readings to make it appear the airliner is on its original course. Their inside man Harry agrees to help for a million-dollar fee and later calls the A-380 pilots to divert the plane to Cortina due to heavy weather in Zurich. Cyrus and his team then successfully divert the flight. On the designated day, the crew takes position on the A-380 during the gold transfer—though engineer Luke seemingly pulls out at the last minute. In fact, Luke never left the operation; he remotely guides the parachute to drop the loot at a secure spot in the Swiss Alps. After safe-cracker Magnus cracks the safe onboard and the henchmen sent by Jorgenson are incapacitated, the crew plans to extract the gold once the plane lands. However, as the airliner nears the Cortina landing strip, the real gold shipment is actually parachuted out into the Alps. Soon after, weeks later, Cyrus reveals to Interpol agent Abby Gladwell (Gugu Mbatha-Raw), a former fling who he convinces to join his operation for cover, that during the heist his team swapped the shipment for iron bars painted to look like gold. Meanwhile, Magnus manages to escape on the ground while the remaining three members are whisked away aboard the Molsen jet with the contraband, headed for Jorgenson’s estate in Tuscany.  

Not content with just one caper, Cyrus’s crew simultaneously embarks on an audacious art heist in Europe. They steal a priceless Van Gogh painting in London at the same time as staging the fake kidnapping of the renowned NFT artist N8 (Jacob Batalon) in Venice. Explaining that stolen masterpieces rapidly increase in value, Cyrus boasts that the crew sold the Van Gogh on the black market for $20 million—a profit used to purchase N8 NFTs. While N8 had been in Venice to auction a unique edition NFT, after being “kidnapped” the value of his NFT soars to $89 million. In exchange for loaning his private jet for the operation, Cyrus promises Molsen that he will persuade N8 to create a special piece of NFT art—a self-portrait mask equipped with 482 cameras that will stream a live 30-second feed from its auction, capturing the exact moment of its sale along with the buyer.  

As complications mount, Cyrus remains cautious knowing that Lars is a dangerous man not to be trifled with. Abby lures Lars with the promise of full immunity for him and his entire crew, and as part of the arrangement, Cyrus insists that Abby join the team to provide cover for Interpol. Cyrus argues that with Abby on board, Interpol will spare them if things go awry, and ultimately Abby resigns from the agency to fully back Cyrus’s operations. Things then take a violent turn when Abby, Cyrus, and Camila are captured at gunpoint by Jorgenson, who executes Leviathan’s representative when his own deal falls through. The situation is further complicated when Jorgenson unexpectedly kills a mole in his organization—Arthur Tigue—and moves up the delivery date on the gold. (It is later revealed that Huxley himself has a mole embedded in Lars’s organization.) Desperate to prevent the gold from reaching Jorgenson, Huxley orders NATO to shoot down the plane.  

In a high-stakes mid-air counterattack, Camila pilots the Molsen jet beneath the A-380 while Abby assembles and activates a signal jammer on the airliner; simultaneously, Camila switches on a transponder to mimic the A-380’s signal. Although Mi-Sun cautions that the odds of successfully jamming both signals are almost nil, Harry—working from air traffic control—contacts NATO fighter pilots with a message that hostages remain on board, forcing them to stand down. As Brussels ATC tracks the flight and Abby’s contact aids behind the scenes, Camila even rigs a drone with the transponder and follows the A-380 to Cortina. Still, the crew is ready as events spiral toward climax.  

Jorgenson’s henchmen, including operatives Cormac (Burn Gorman) and Donal (Paul Anderson), launch a hijack attempt that results in the airliner crash-landing at Cortina; Camila then manages to land the Molsen jet at the airport. The stolen gold is briefly reloaded onto a Sky Suisse A-380 destined for Zurich, but another brawl between the crew and Jorgenson’s men forces the jet to crash on the grounds of his villa. In the ensuing mayhem, Magnus, Abby, Cyrus, and Camila are captured. As the Carabinieri arrive on scene, Cyrus uses N8’s cutting-edge NFT technology to present a recording of Jorgenson murdering Leviathan’s representative, sealing the case against the crime lord.  

In the aftermath, Jorgenson is arrested while Abby, enraged upon learning that Commander Huxley authorized the NATO attack, punches him. Back at the auction, Abby charges Denton with fraud after deducing that his apparent limp was feigned so he could participate in bidding more than $10 million—money he could not possibly cover—thus making him eligible for extradition to the US. Ultimately, the crew recovers their ill-gotten gold haul and celebrates their success, with Cyrus and Abby igniting a renewed personal connection. Even N8 joins in the festivities when his NFT drops a cool $27 million, marking the successful conclusion of an intricately orchestrated double heist.

question:
The following plot summary of a movie has had the sentences randomly reordered. Rewrite the plot summary with the sentences correctly ordered. Begin the plot summary with <PLOT_SUMMARY>.

The sentences are:

Dean sets up Ricky to present his game changer idea to Ted for the World River merger. Three childhood friends (Dean (Zac Efron), Wes (Jermaine Fowler), and JT (Andrew Santino)) prank one of their neighbors on Halloween Night (in 1999( by lighting a bag of dog feces on fire and leaving it on their doorstep. In anger, Dean tells him that he is Rod, not Ricky. At the hospital, the trio learn that Susan already gave birth to a boy named Whitaker. When Rod gives the trio the impression that he personally knows Carly's ex, Gary Polisner, they decide to drug Polisner with a Ketamine pill, but the Rabbi eats the pill instead. Dean feels bad about how Rod was treated and apologizes to him, and this is when Rod gives Dean his business card. The fire spreads to the neighbor's scarecrow. Summerhayes asks Dean his thoughts, and they agree to the merger. On their flight, the trio turn off their phones, post something as 'Ricky', and write in their Bible of Ricky Stanicky, detailing all of what 'Ricky Stanicky' has done. Erin is heartbroken and says that it is too late for his apologies now. After learning the truth about Ricky, Susan tells JT he has to camp in the backyard for six months as punishment. Dean and JT are angry as this is more than what they make. Shortly after, Dean learns that Susan went into labor six weeks early, forcing them to hurry back. But Ted is also impressed when Ricky displays his knowledge of Ted's upcoming merger with World River. Erin reveals to Dean that she decided to pursue the story about Rod becoming Ricky. While in Atlantic City, they meet Rock-Hard Rod (John Cena), an actor and impersonator who sings sex-based parodies of popular songs. Erin and Susan encourage Dean and JT to spend time with Ricky. Rod reveals that he legally changed his name to Richard Barbara Stanicky and tells Dean that he is thankful for being given a new life. At the party, Ricky tells the trio that Carly is now his fiance, and that they are all going to work on cleaning the environment on the weekend. As Summerhayes is about to fire Dean, the World River executives approach Summerhayes and enthusiastically approve of his choice to hire Ricky, ready to agree to a merger. Ricky riles Ted when he calls him an old school banker who works to make rich people richer. Ted promotes Ricky as he believes Ricky tells him the truth. Failing to put out the fire, Dean writes the name 'Ricky Stanicky' on one of their costume pieces, leading police to believe that Ricky Stanicky, an out-of-town kid, was responsible for the prank. Erin meets with Dean and tells him that she knows Ricky Stanicky is Rock-Hard Rod. Rod says that he cannot go back to Atlantic City as he will be killed for some things he did (including being in debt to some mafia types), which he doesn't remember as he was drunk. Erin states it will be difficult, but hearing Ricky's recording of Dean talking about his love and appreciation for Erin helps. Ricky gives his stamp of approval to the merger. Erin also drops by, revealing that she scored a reporting gig for a local news channel's 'Hero of the Week' segment, and is pursuing a story on Ricky and his alleged humanitarian efforts. The next day, there is a party between Summerhayes' company and World River, where they intend to watch the premiere of Ricky's 'Hero of the Week' segment. Dean gets a call from 'Ricky' (who is really Wes), claiming that his testicular cancer is back, and that he is alone in Albany, New York. The 'Hero of the Week' story begins playing, and Rod tells the reporter about how he met Dean, and how the Ricky Stanicky Bible made him realize that he needed to change his life. At the Bris, Rod impresses everyone with his personality and knowledge as 'Ricky', including Leona, Carly (Erin's cousin), and Ted Summerhayes (William H. Twenty years later, the trio continued to use Ricky Stanicky as their excuse to forego life obligations and avoid getting in trouble. Macy) (Dean and JT's boss). During the credits, videos and pictures are shown with Ricky and others cleaning, Carly donating her hair to children, Wes becoming a published author, JT brushing his teeth outside near his Porta-potty while Susan and Whitaker watch, everyone posing at Dean and Erin's wedding, and a viral TikTok remix made with Summerhayes' comedic jerking motions at various conferences. The guys had a 'Bible' on Ricky which had notes on every lie they told to their families about stuff they did with Ricky and share the same with Rod to bring him up to speed. Ricky also tells Ted that he has an 'Air-Dicking' habit when he gives presentations. In reality, JT and Dean received tickets to see Marc Rebillet in Atlantic City, New Jersey. Wes also told Keith that he dated Ricky (who he said was a bi), just in case he needed an out with Keith. The next day, Summerhayes reveals that in preparation for their merger with World River, a major company from San Francisco, he has hired Ricky Stanicky for $250,000 per year to advise on the World River deal. Wes almost tells everyone the truth, but Dean pivots by saying that Ricky lied in order to celebrate being 5 years cancer-free with his best friends. Dean & JT plan to get Ricky fired to get him out of their lives. At the party, Summerhayes introduces Dean, who confesses to all the guests that Ricky Stanicky is fake, apologizing and promptly leaving the party. It turns out that Wes has been using the Ricky gig to score some alone time for himself (at the pot milk farm) away from his partner Keith (Daniel Monks). Leona tells the trio that Ricky is invited to Whitaker's Bris. Ricky uses Summerhayes' cigar cutter to complete the circumcision, causing everyone to celebrate. While Wes believes that it is time for them to come clean, Dean decides to hire Rod to play Ricky Stanicky. Dean is depressed, as he is going to lose his job and relationship with Erin once Ricky is proven to be a fraud. Rod is a major mooch, and soon the friends tire of him and want to be rid of him. Ted realizes that nobody listens to a word he says as they are distracted by his mannerisms on stage. JT's mother-in-law, Leona (Heather Mitchell), does not believe Ricky Stanicky is real. Dean asks if she can forgive him. JT and his wife, Susan (Anja Savcic), are about to have a baby shower, and Dean and his girlfriend, Erin (Lex Scott Davis), have been setting it up. Summerhayes decides to start a charity organization per Ricky's suggestion and makes Ricky the head of the World River merger, replacing Dean. Rod has no idea about the merger and begins to record Dean to ask for advice. During the circumcision, the Rabbi Greenberg (Jeff Ross) has a reaction to the Ketamine, leaving Whitaker half-circumcised.

Summerhayes asks Dean his thoughts, and they agree to the merger. After learning the truth about Ricky, Susan tells JT he has to camp in the backyard for six months as punishment. Erin reveals to Dean that she decided to pursue the story about Rod becoming Ricky. Dean asks if she can forgive him. Erin states it will be difficult, but hearing Ricky's recording of Dean talking about his love and appreciation for Erin helps. At the party, Ricky tells the trio that Carly is now his fiance, and that they are all going to work on cleaning the environment on the weekend. During the credits, videos and pictures are shown with Ricky and others cleaning, Carly donating her hair to children, Wes becoming a published author, JT brushing his teeth outside near his Porta-potty while Susan and Whitaker watch, everyone posing at Dean and Erin's wedding, and a viral TikTok remix made with Summerhayes' comedic jerking motions at various conferences.
anthropic/claude-3-7-sonnet-20250219:
<PLOT_SUMMARY>

Three childhood friends (Dean (Zac Efron), Wes (Jermaine Fowler), and JT (Andrew Santino)) prank one of their neighbors on Halloween Night (in 1999) by lighting a bag of dog feces on fire and leaving it on their doorstep. The fire spreads to the neighbor's scarecrow. Failing to put out the fire, Dean writes the name 'Ricky Stanicky' on one of their costume pieces, leading police to believe that Ricky Stanicky, an out-of-town kid, was responsible for the prank.

Twenty years later, the trio continued to use Ricky Stanicky as their excuse to forego life obligations and avoid getting in trouble. The guys had a 'Bible' on Ricky which had notes on every lie they told to their families about stuff they did with Ricky and share the same with Rod to bring him up to speed. Wes also told Keith that he dated Ricky (who he said was a bi), just in case he needed an out with Keith.

JT and his wife, Susan (Anja Savcic), are about to have a baby shower, and Dean and his girlfriend, Erin (Lex Scott Davis), have been setting it up. JT's mother-in-law, Leona (Heather Mitchell), does not believe Ricky Stanicky is real. Dean gets a call from 'Ricky' (who is really Wes), claiming that his testicular cancer is back, and that he is alone in Albany, New York. In reality, JT and Dean received tickets to see Marc Rebillet in Atlantic City, New Jersey.

While in Atlantic City, they meet Rock-Hard Rod (John Cena), an actor and impersonator who sings sex-based parodies of popular songs. While Wes believes that it is time for them to come clean, Dean decides to hire Rod to play Ricky Stanicky.

Leona tells the trio that Ricky is invited to Whitaker's Bris. Erin and Susan encourage Dean and JT to spend time with Ricky. It turns out that Wes has been using the Ricky gig to score some alone time for himself (at the pot milk farm) away from his partner Keith (Daniel Monks).

At the Bris, Rod impresses everyone with his personality and knowledge as 'Ricky', including Leona, Carly (Erin's cousin), and Ted Summerhayes (William H. Macy) (Dean and JT's boss). During the circumcision, the Rabbi Greenberg (Jeff Ross) has a reaction to the Ketamine, leaving Whitaker half-circumcised. Ricky uses Summerhayes' cigar cutter to complete the circumcision, causing everyone to celebrate.

The next day, Summerhayes reveals that in preparation for their merger with World River, a major company from San Francisco, he has hired Ricky Stanicky for $250,000 per year to advise on the World River deal. Dean and JT are angry as this is more than what they make. Dean & JT plan to get Ricky fired to get him out of their lives.

At the party, Ricky tells the trio that Carly is now his fiance, and that they are all going to work on cleaning the environment on the weekend. Erin also drops by, revealing that she scored a reporting gig for a local news channel's 'Hero of the Week' segment, and is pursuing a story on Ricky and his alleged humanitarian efforts.

When Rod gives the trio the impression that he personally knows Carly's ex, Gary Polisner, they decide to drug Polisner with a Ketamine pill, but the Rabbi eats the pill instead. Rod says that he cannot go back to Atlantic City as he will be killed for some things he did (including being in debt to some mafia types), which he doesn't remember as he was drunk. Rod is a major mooch, and soon the friends tire of him and want to be rid of him.

Dean sets up Ricky to present his game changer idea to Ted for the World River merger. Ricky riles Ted when he calls him an old school banker who works to make rich people richer. Ricky also tells Ted that he has an 'Air-Dicking' habit when he gives presentations. But Ted is also impressed when Ricky displays his knowledge of Ted's upcoming merger with World River. Ted promotes Ricky as he believes Ricky tells him the truth.

Ted realizes that nobody listens to a word he says as they are distracted by his mannerisms on stage. Summerhayes decides to start a charity organization per Ricky's suggestion and makes Ricky the head of the World River merger, replacing Dean. In anger, Dean tells him that he is Rod, not Ricky.

Rod has no idea about the merger and begins to record Dean to ask for advice. Erin meets with Dean and tells him that she knows Ricky Stanicky is Rock-Hard Rod. Erin reveals to Dean that she decided to pursue the story about Rod becoming Ricky. Erin is heartbroken and says that it is too late for his apologies now.

Shortly after, Dean learns that Susan went into labor six weeks early, forcing them to hurry back. At the hospital, the trio learn that Susan already gave birth to a boy named Whitaker. Wes almost tells everyone the truth, but Dean pivots by saying that Ricky lied in order to celebrate being 5 years cancer-free with his best friends.

The next day, there is a party between Summerhayes' company and World River, where they intend to watch the premiere of Ricky's 'Hero of the Week' segment. Dean is depressed, as he is going to lose his job and relationship with Erin once Ricky is proven to be a fraud.

The 'Hero of the Week' story begins playing, and Rod tells the reporter about how he met Dean, and how the Ricky Stanicky Bible made him realize that he needed to change his life. Rod reveals that he legally changed his name to Richard Barbara Stanicky and tells Dean that he is thankful for being given a new life.

Dean feels bad about how Rod was treated and apologizes to him, and this is when Rod gives Dean his business card. At the party, Summerhayes introduces Dean, who confesses to all the guests that Ricky Stanicky is fake, apologizing and promptly leaving the party.

As Summerhayes is about to fire Dean, the World River executives approach Summerhayes and enthusiastically approve of his choice to hire Ricky, ready to agree to a merger. Ricky gives his stamp of approval to the merger. Summerhayes asks Dean his thoughts, and they agree to the merger.

Dean asks if she can forgive him. Erin states it will be difficult, but hearing Ricky's recording of Dean talking about his love and appreciation for Erin helps. After learning the truth about Ricky, Susan tells JT he has to camp in the backyard for six months as punishment.

On their flight, the trio turn off their phones, post something as 'Ricky', and write in their Bible of Ricky Stanicky, detailing all of what 'Ricky Stanicky' has done.

During the credits, videos and pictures are shown with Ricky and others cleaning, Carly donating her hair to children, Wes becoming a published author, JT brushing his teeth outside near his Porta-potty while Susan and Whitaker watch, everyone posing at Dean and Erin's wedding, and a viral TikTok remix made with Summerhayes' comedic jerking motions at various conferences.
openai/o3-mini-2025-01-31:
<PLOT_SUMMARY>Three childhood friends – Dean (Zac Efron), Wes (Jermaine Fowler), and JT (Andrew Santino) – pull an outrageous prank on one of their neighbors on Halloween night in 1999 by lighting a bag of dog feces on fire and leaving it on his doorstep. The flames quickly spread to the neighbor’s scarecrow, and when they can’t put out the fire, Dean hastily scrawls the name “Ricky Stanicky” on one of their costume pieces, causing local police to suspect an out‐of‐town kid of the deed. In his own anger during a confrontation, Dean tells the irate neighbor, “I’m Rod, not Ricky.” Later, feeling remorse over how Rod was treated, Dean apologizes—and it is at that moment that Rod hands him his business card. In a twist of misadventure, when Rod impresses the trio by claiming personal acquaintance with Carly’s ex, Gary Polisner, they decide to drug Polisner with a Ketamine pill; however, the plan backfires when the Rabbi ends up swallowing the pill instead.  
 
Not long after these chaotic early events, Dean learns that Susan has gone into labor six weeks early, forcing them to rush back to the hospital where the trio discovers that Susan has already given birth to a boy named Whitaker. On the flight back, the friends switch off their phones and post something under the name “Ricky,” even going so far as to record every outrageous claim about “Ricky Stanicky” in a makeshift “Bible” detailing all the lies they’ve told their families. Capitalizing on this invented persona, Dean later sets up “Ricky” to present his game changer idea to Ted for the World River merger. Ted is impressed when “Ricky” displays insider knowledge of his upcoming deal with World River—even as “Ricky” goads him by calling him an old school banker who only works to make rich people richer. Convinced by the candor (and an offhand admission that includes an “Air-Dicking” presentation habit), Ted promotes “Ricky,” and soon Summerhayes, after consulting with Dean, agrees to the merger. The very next day, Summerhayes reveals that in preparation for a merger with a major San Francisco company, he’s hired “Ricky Stanicky” for $250,000 a year as an advisor.  
 
While in Atlantic City, the trio encounter the real-life Rock-Hard Rod (John Cena), an actor and impersonator famous for singing sexual parodies of popular songs. Spurred on by the novelty, Erin later confides in Dean that she’s decided to pursue the story of how Rod became “Ricky,” and along with Susan, she encourages Dean and JT to spend additional time with “Ricky.” It isn’t long before Rod drops a bombshell: he has legally changed his name to Richard Barbara Stanicky and thanks Dean for giving him a chance at a new life. Riding this wave of success, “Ricky” gives his stamp of approval to the merger, and further media attention follows when Erin reveals she’s landed a reporting gig for a local channel’s “Hero of the Week” segment focusing on his alleged humanitarian efforts. At a celebratory party organized by Summerhayes’ company and World River—where everyone is eager to watch the debut of the “Hero of the Week” story—Dean receives a call from “Ricky” (actually Wes in disguise), claiming his testicular cancer has returned and he’s stranded in Albany, New York. As the segment airs, Rod is on camera describing how meeting Dean and poring over the “Ricky Stanicky Bible” changed his life, and later at a Bris, he charms everyone with his “Ricky” persona – impressing figures like Leona, Carly (Erin’s cousin), and even Ted Summerhayes (William H. Macy, who is also Dean and JT’s boss). Yet not everyone is convinced; JT’s mother-in-law, Leona, openly doubts that Ricky Stanicky is even real, and Dean pleads for her forgiveness.  
 
When the truth about “Ricky” eventually comes to light, Susan punishes JT by making him camp in the backyard for six months—a penalty that leaves both Dean and JT fuming, especially since it ends up costing them more than they earn. Wes nearly blurts out the whole truth to everyone, but Dean deftly pivots by insisting that “Ricky” lied merely to celebrate being five years cancer-free in the company of his best friends. Determined to put an end to the charade, Dean and JT hatch a plan to get “Ricky” fired. At a later party, Summerhayes introduces Dean, who then shockingly confesses to all the guests that “Ricky Stanicky” is nothing but an elaborate fraud—and then promptly departs in humiliation. It soon turns out that Wes has been using the “Ricky” gig all along to sneak off for some alone time (at a secluded “pot milk” farm) away from his partner, Keith. Unsurprisingly, Dean falls into a deep depression as he realizes that exposing the con could cost him his job and ruin his relationship with Erin.  
 
Even as Wes believes it’s time for complete honesty, Dean decides instead to double down by hiring Rod to impersonate “Ricky Stanicky.” Not long afterward, Dean’s girlfriend Erin meets with him and reveals that she already knows “Ricky Stanicky” is none other than Rock-Hard Rod. Although Erin admits the path ahead will be difficult, hearing a recording of Dean speaking about his deep love and appreciation for her helps soothe the blow. Meanwhile, Rod proves to be a major moocher, and the friends quickly grow tired of his antics. During a company event, Ted finds himself increasingly ignored as his own dramatic mannerisms distract everyone on stage.  
 
As things continue to unravel, JT and his wife Susan prepare for a baby shower while Dean and Erin work to set it all up. In a further twist, Summerhayes decides to start a charity organization—at “Ricky’s” behest—and makes “Ricky” the head of the World River merger, effectively replacing Dean. Oblivious to the full magnitude of the merger, Rod even ends up recording Dean to ask for advice. During the ensuing chaos at Whitaker’s circumcision, a Ketamine-induced reaction by Rabbi Greenberg leaves the baby only half-circumcised, prompting an odd round of celebration.  
 
In a series of amusing side notes, it is revealed that in reality JT and Dean once scored tickets to see Marc Rebillet in Atlantic City, and Wes had told his friend Keith that he once dated “Ricky” (whom he described as bisexual) just in case he ever needed an alibi. Twenty years later, the trio still use the “Ricky Stanicky” story as an excuse to shirk life’s responsibilities and avoid trouble, and as the credits roll, viewers are treated to a montage: videos and photos of “Ricky” and his cohorts cleaning up, Carly donating her hair to children, Wes emerging as a published author, JT brushing his teeth outside his porta-potty as Susan and little Whitaker watch, everyone posing at Dean and Erin’s wedding, and even a viral TikTok remix featuring Summerhayes’ hysterical conference antics.

question:
The following plot summary of a movie has had the sentences randomly reordered. Rewrite the plot summary with the sentences correctly ordered. Begin the plot summary with <PLOT_SUMMARY>.

The sentences are:

While they both live alone, the two are friendly with one another -- Clay sees Eloise as the only person who ever took care of him. He rents some space in a barn owned by retired teacher Eloise Parker, a widow who owns and lives in the house on the property. Derek assigns the company's head of security, former CIA director Wallace Westwyld, to find a way to stop Adam. Verona learns that Eloise was scammed out of every penny she had. Devastated by the realization that she got scammed out of so much, Eloise shoots herself in the head. Upon learning the hard way that Adam is after them, Garnett explains the situation to the crew's ringleader, 28-year-old tech executive Derek Danforth, who runs a Boston-based corporation called Danforth Enterprises. In Hampden, Massachusetts, Adam Clay is a beekeeper who has several hives of bees. But Wallace learns that Adam is a retired member of a classified program called the Beekeepers, whose members are tasked with fighting different forms of corruption, operating above and beyond governmental jurisdiction. The call center's manager, Mickey Garnett, cons Eloise out of everything -- including more than $2,000,000 that's in the account of Safe Homes Foundation, a children's charity whose account she manages. The Beekeepers are so efficient and well-trained that they make the military look like a joke. Adam is quickly cleared when Eloise's death is ruled a suicide because there was no gunshot residue on Adam, and Eloise's fingerprints were the only prints on the gun. Verona apologizes to Adam for her accusation, and she tells him that the FBI cyber-crimes office has told her that the scammer crew that victimized Eloise has been operating for two years, but the FBI hasn't been able to identify any of the scammers. Adam finds Eloise's body in her house, and he's immediately arrested by Eloise's daughter, Boston-based FBI Special Agent Verona Parker, who hastily accuses Adam of shooting Eloise. She calls the number on the screen, and connects to a call center that's located in Springfield, Massachusetts, not aware that it's a phishing scam. Verona vows to find the scammers, but Adam, enraged by what happened, decides to hunt down the scammers himself, and make them pay for what they did to Eloise. Wallace realizes that Adam is a man who should be feared by people like Derek. Adam proves to be an unstoppable force, and Derek, Garnett, and the rest of the scammers have no idea what kind of scorched-Earth hell Adam is about to unleash on them. While checking some things on her laptop computer, Eloise sees a warning about two viruses in the system.
ground_truth: In Hampden, Massachusetts, Adam Clay is a beekeeper who has several hives of bees. He rents some space in a barn owned by retired teacher Eloise Parker, a widow who owns and lives in the house on the property. While they both live alone, the two are friendly with one another -- Clay sees Eloise as the only person who ever took care of him. While checking some things on her laptop computer, Eloise sees a warning about two viruses in the system. She calls the number on the screen, and connects to a call center that's located in Springfield, Massachusetts, not aware that it's a phishing scam. The call center's manager, Mickey Garnett, cons Eloise out of everything -- including more than $2,000,000 that's in the account of Safe Homes Foundation, a children's charity whose account she manages. Devastated by the realization that she got scammed out of so much, Eloise shoots herself in the head. Adam finds Eloise's body in her house, and he's immediately arrested by Eloise's daughter, Boston-based FBI Special Agent Verona Parker, who hastily accuses Adam of shooting Eloise. Verona learns that Eloise was scammed out of every penny she had. Adam is quickly cleared when Eloise's death is ruled a suicide because there was no gunshot residue on Adam, and Eloise's fingerprints were the only prints on the gun. Verona apologizes to Adam for her accusation, and she tells him that the FBI cyber-crimes office has told her that the scammer crew that victimized Eloise has been operating for two years, but the FBI hasn't been able to identify any of the scammers. Verona vows to find the scammers, but Adam, enraged by what happened, decides to hunt down the scammers himself, and make them pay for what they did to Eloise. Upon learning the hard way that Adam is after them, Garnett explains the situation to the crew's ringleader, 28-year-old tech executive Derek Danforth, who runs a Boston-based corporation called Danforth Enterprises. Derek assigns the company's head of security, former CIA director Wallace Westwyld, to find a way to stop Adam. But Wallace learns that Adam is a retired member of a classified program called the Beekeepers, whose members are tasked with fighting different forms of corruption, operating above and beyond governmental jurisdiction. The Beekeepers are so efficient and well-trained that they make the military look like a joke. Wallace realizes that Adam is a man who should be feared by people like Derek. Adam proves to be an unstoppable force, and Derek, Garnett, and the rest of the scammers have no idea what kind of scorched-Earth hell Adam is about to unleash on them.

Verona apologizes to Adam for her accusation, and she tells him that the FBI cyber-crimes office has told her that the scammer crew that victimized Eloise has been operating for two years, but the FBI hasn't been able to identify any of the scammers. Verona vows to find the scammers, but Adam, enraged by what happened, decides to hunt down the scammers himself, and make them pay for what they did to Eloise. Upon learning the hard way that Adam is after them, Garnett explains the situation to the crew's ringleader, 28-year-old tech executive Derek Danforth, who runs a Boston-based corporation called Danforth Enterprises. Derek assigns the company's head of security, former CIA director Wallace Westwyld, to find a way to stop Adam. But Wallace learns that Adam is a retired member of a classified program called the Beekeepers, whose members are tasked with fighting different forms of corruption, operating above and beyond governmental jurisdiction. The Beekeepers are so efficient and well-trained that they make the military look like a joke. Wallace realizes that Adam is a man who should be feared by people like Derek. Adam proves to be an unstoppable force, and Derek, Garnett, and the rest of the scammers have no idea what kind of scorched-Earth hell Adam is about to unleash on them.

Mack writes a feature about New Yorkers’ favorite sports memories, asking both Adam and Nick to read a draft. She tells Mack that they broke up because Claire could tell that Adam was in love with Mack; Mack is initially resistant, but eventually admits that she has feelings for him too. The two have sex, but Mack is disappointed to find that he only considers her a one-night stand. Mack is a 33-year-old sports journalist in New York City who is known for her ‘plays’, complex deceptions to find hook-ups for herself and her friends - best friend Adam, co-worker Brannagan, and his brother Little. While she enjoys her life, she yearns for a more serious relationship. She convinces Adam to help her ensnare Nick. She hopes to find one in Nick, a sophisticated war correspondent who has just joined their newspaper. While at brunch, Mack and Adam demonstrate their natural chemistry and long history together, making Claire uncomfortable with their closeness. Adam avoids contact with Mack, but agrees to help Ashley surprise Little - who she has started dating - with tickets to the game that Mack is working. The plan begins with Mack intentionally running into Nick, but ignoring him, attracting his attention. Adam becomes upset at Nick’s treatment of her and storms off. While Adam immediately reads and loves the piece, Nick is slow to get to it while working on his latest manuscript. After finding out that he is going on a third date with another girl, the group - having also recruited the paper’s secretary Ashley - schemes to call his date away with an emergency, allowing Mack to take his place. The two break up, and Mack submits her version of the story, which her editor loves, assigning her to work a Yankees game for the first time. The two start dating, while Adam begins seeing a new girl, Claire. After confronting her, she reveals that she broke up with Adam after their brunch, unbeknownst to the group. The two share a kiss before Mack runs off to work the game. The foursome research Nick’s habits and preferences, eventually devising a play called ‘The Flurry’. Mack and Nick fight about the piece that night, where Nick reveals that her job could be in jeopardy in the next round of layoffs at the paper. Nervous about dealing She convinces Adam to run a play with her at brunch, who reluctantly agrees but cautions her to take the relationship more seriously. To Adam’s surprise, he is actually the target of the play: letting Mack confess her love outside the stadium. As the group - minus Adam - celebrates Mack’s success, they see Claire with another man. At a gala event where Nick is receiving a humanitarian award from UNICEF, Mack reveals that Nick has rewritten her piece entirely rather than giving feedback.

The plan to attract Nick unfolds when Mack intentionally runs into him and deliberately ignores him, successfully garnering his attention. In response to his indifferent treatment of her, Adam becomes upset and storms off. Meanwhile, while Adam immediately reads and loves the piece, Nick is slow to get to it as he’s preoccupied with work on his latest manuscript. 

After Mack learns that Nick is going on a third date with another girl, the group—enlisting the help of the paper’s secretary Ashley—schemes to call his date away with an emergency so that Mack can take her place. Mack and Nick end up spending the night together, but she is disappointed when she realizes he considers it nothing more than a one-night stand. That same night, they fight about the feature, during which Nick reveals that Mack’s job might be in jeopardy in the next round of layoffs at the paper. Frustrated by the evening’s events, the two break up, and Mack submits her version of the story; her editor loves it and even assigns her to cover a Yankees game for the first time. 

Shortly thereafter, after Mack confronts Claire, Claire reveals that she had broken up with Adam following their brunch—an admission that no one else knew about. Claire goes on to explain that the breakup happened because she could tell Adam was in love with Mack. Though Mack is initially resistant to this idea, she eventually admits that she does have feelings for Adam. Nervous about dealing with the fallout of her failed experiment with Nick, Mack convinces Adam to run one more play with her at brunch. Adam reluctantly agrees but cautions her to take the relationship more seriously. To his surprise, he soon finds out that he is actually the target of Mack’s second play—a plan in which she intends to confess her love outside the stadium. 

In a culminating moment before she rushes off to work the game, Mack and Adam share a kiss. As the rest of the group—minus Adam—celebrates Mack’s success, they notice Claire in the company of another man. Later, at a gala event where Nick is receiving a humanitarian award from UNICEF, Mack reveals that Nick has completely rewritten her feature rather than simply offering feedback. In the end, the fallout rewards true feelings: Mack and Adam start dating, while Adam begins seeing a new girl, Claire.

question:
The following plot summary of a movie has had the sentences randomly reordered. Rewrite the plot summary with the sentences correctly ordered. Begin the plot summary with <PLOT_SUMMARY>.

The sentences are:

The therapist moves on to discuss Artist's abusive relationship with a Libra; she is convinced by astrology that they are a good fit, but her friends are concerned for her well-being (‘Rebound’). During her session, she tells the therapist about a dream she recently had that follows her through their childhood neighborhood in the Bronx. Alida and Taroo, an ancient Puerto Rican legend about two star-crossed lovers from feuding tribes, has greatly influenced Artist's opinions on love and romance. They conclude that in order for her to break her romantic cycle, she must rise above her physical self by embarking on a self-love journey without their assistance. While Artist continues with her ill-advised lifestyle, her friends stage an intervention. With a new lease on life, Artist attends Mike's wedding alone and encounters several hummingbirds that lead her to her true love (‘Midnight Trip to Vegas’, ‘Hummingbird’). Before Artist leaves, he recommends that she contacts Love Addicts Anonymous; she is hesitant at first, but eventually joins a group session and shares her story (‘Broken Like Me’). As she leaves in the morning for a therapy session, Mike, a member of her friend group, invites her to his wedding; given his cynical take on love, the invitation bewilders her. She encounters a younger version of herself and apologizes through tears for abandoning their needs, causing her heart to be fully restored (‘This Is Me Now’). Now in the present, Artist shares her dream with her therapist. She leaves him for good following a heated argument that grows violent, while the Zodiacal Council, composed of 10 of the 12 astrological signs, questions the origin of her poor romantic decisions. The Zodiacal Council is alarmed by how quickly Artist is going through her relationships, as well as by the gossip that is emerging as a result. She reflects on their story in a dream where she finds herself enjoying a motorcycle ride with her biker lover. Suddenly, the two suffer a severe crash that leaves Artist's heart ruptured. They believe that she might be a sex addict, which she quickly denies by criticizing their own romantic choices. He finds her dreams to be eccentric, which she blames on the conflicting astrological signs between him and his wife. In therapy, she defends her reputation as a hopeless romantic until Joe interrupts her for time. With the help of factory workers, she attempts to prevent her heart from breaking by using the age-old myth as a central guide, but to no avail (‘Hearts and Flowers’). Artist returns home and burns old love letters and childhood memories while a hummingbird, found in Alida and Taroo, furiously knocks on her window. Before they could piece together an answer, Artist enters three unsuccessful marriages with a Pisces, a Virgo, and a Cancer, respectively (‘Can't Get Enough’).

The following plot summary of a movie has had the sentences randomly reordered. Rewrite the plot summary with the sentences correctly ordered. Begin the plot summary with <PLOT_SUMMARY>.

Jaycen ‘Two-J's’ Jennings is an arrogant washed up former football superstar. They almost win until one of the players misses the line to make the touchdown, causing the other team to win, but everyone still remains inspired by the underdog team, and Jaycen appears to get back with Cherise. Despite being rough on the kids at first, Jaycen finds a way to connect with them and help inspire them to do better. After a major car accident, Jaycen is ordered to perform community service in his old neighborhood. Despite trying to revive his career, Jaycen chooses to be with the team. He sees an opportunity to rebuild his brand by coaching a struggling youth football team, where one of the players is the son of his former flame Cherise. Jaycen sees an opportunity for a comeback by having his own sports show, but the first taping is on the day of the team's big game.

question:
The following plot summary of a movie has had the sentences randomly reordered. Rewrite the plot summary with the sentences correctly ordered. Begin the plot summary with <PLOT_SUMMARY>.

The sentences are:

As Kabir and his family recuperate at the hospital, Vanraj's hostages are safely returned to their homes by the police who inform Kabir that Vanraj has gone missing. After eating a laddu Vanraj gives her, Janhvi obeys his every command like a puppet. He orders Janhvi to laugh herself to death and reveals that even if he is killed, Janhvi will continue acting on his last order until her death. Kabir cuts Vanraj's tongue off; when the girls try to kill him, he plays an edited recording of Vanraj's voice, in which he declares their freedom. He mocks Vanraj, who can no longer speak, for wanting power and states that true power comes from parents, who can go to any extent to protect their children. Realising their children might actually die, Kabir and Jyoti give him permission to take Janhvi. He asks them to give her to him, as he needs their permission to do so. The family is unsettled by his presence and Kabir asks him to leave. Vanraj wakes up and becomes very disappointed at this and as a result he asks her to undress herself and change her clothes. He survives her attempt, though grievously wounded when Jhanvi throw him from the terrace. Jyoti drives Dhruv to the hospital while, unbeknownst to Vanraj, Kabir trails him to his lair, having fixed a tracker in his cellphone earlier. Kabir offers money in exchange for sparing them but Vanraj sets the money on fire, declaring that he has no use for materialistic things; he reveals himself to be a demon who aims to control the world, believing himself to be as good as God. He then tells Vanraj that they will meet again the next day and leaves while Vanraj continues to suffer. Thus, the girls are freed from his control. When her father tries to steal Vanraj's phone, Janhvi urinates in her shorts to stop him so she does not have to stab him. He then requests her to dance for him; he then goes to sleep, instructing Janhvi to stab anyone who approaches. When police respond to a call from Jyoti's hidden cellphone, the family acts normal to prevent Janhvi from causing an explosion in the house. It is revealed that Vanraj has kept 108 other girls similarly hypnotised. Janhvi, upon Vanraj's orders, prevents her father from kicking him out. This compels Kabir to let him go, but Vanraj instructs Janhvi to kill her brother. Kabir Rishi, a chartered accountant, and his wife Jyoti reside in Dehradun, Uttarakhand with their kids Janhvi and Dhruv. When they refuse, Vanraj cuts the phone lines and torments the family by dictating Janhvi to do strange and cruel things, such as hitting herself, eating dry tea leaves, and attacking her brother. Having had enough and seeing Jhanvi naked, Kabir and Jyoti attack Vanraj. Vanraj arrives at the farmhouse, claiming that his phone's battery has died. A year later, Kabir is seen going down into an isolated chamber, where he has, in fact, held Vanraj captive. With Janhvi as the last addition, he prepares to sacrifice them. Earlier, Kabir had taken the home's security camera recording of Vanraj speaking to Janhvi, then spliced his words together to make it seem like Vanraj is ordering the girls to go back to normal. He declares that this is hell now and he is Vanraj's devil. On a vacation to their farmhouse at a remote hill station, they meet an enigmatic man, Vanraj Kashyap. This will complete the ritual for him to acquire the power to control anyone at will, as he believes humans do not deserve free will. Vanraj reveals that he has hypnotised her through black magic; she will obey every command he gives.

However, Patty is haunted by his past after he lost his fiancée in a previous mission. Determined to rescue him, Patty defies orders and joins a covert mission. Despite Rocky's orders, Patty, Taj, and Bash cross the Indo-Pakistan border. He is posted as a flying instructor at the Air Force Academy in Hyderabad. Group captain Rakesh 'Rocky' Jai Singh is assigned to counter the threat and forms a team called 'Air Dragons' consisting of skilled fighter pilots. The team learn of an attack on CRPF soldiers in Pulwama, organized by Akhtar. During training, the team members bond, and Minni develops romantic feelings for Patty. Despite succeeding in the mission, the aftermath causes conflict between India and Pakistan. It is revealed to Minni by Rocky that he holds a grudge against Patty for letting his fiancée, Naina Jai Singh (revealed to be Rocky's younger sister), die in a previous rescue mission. In the post-credit scene, Minni and Patty embrace, celebrating their victory. In Srinagar, Jammu and Kashmir, a terrorist organization led by Azhar Akhtar, plan to attack India, targeting the Srinagar Air Force Station base of the Indian Air Force. In response, the Indian Air Force, along with RAW agent Zarina Begum, plan a counterattack on Akhtar's base in Balakot. However, the Air Dragons team gets a shock as the chopper which had gone to receive Taj and Bash return only with Bash's dead body. Taj and Bash's plane is shot down by Pakistani pilots leading to them getting captured. The team successfully infiltrate the enemy territory and Patty is able to rescue Taj and kill Akhtar. question:
The following plot summary of a movie has had the sentences randomly reordered. Rewrite the plot summary with the sentences correctly ordered. Begin the plot summary with <PLOT_SUMMARY>.

The sentences are:

Subhash, one of the friends, falls into a covered hole in the ground while moving towards them. They are scared to go inside the hole to retrieve him. They try lowering the rope, for Subhash to hold, but are sceptical that he may not be in a situation to hold on to the rope after a deep fall. Kuttan is able to retrieve him and the rest of the friends pull them up together successfully. They are also accused of murdering Subhash and giving false complaints and no help is offered. After etching it on the wall, the friends call out to show the remaining guys who are exploring on the other sides to take a picture and they all regroup. On the way, he informs them that the last person who fell into the hole was the former Central Minister's nephew around ten years ago and all the forces had gotten together to rescue him, but no one had been able to. Finally after being convinced, and fearing backlash from the local people for failing to help, one of the police officers agrees to go with them to the cave. After the initial shock, a few of them run back to get help and others stay and continue calling out to him in hopes that he would respond. After receiving first aid from the nearest clinic, they take Subhash to the hospital in their hometown, where he is treated more thoroughly. Seeing this, one of the friends, Siju David, decides to go down. Later, the news that Kuttan saved Subhash comes out from a person who went to Tamil Nadu and Kuttan is applauded for his bravery. In 2006, a group of 10 friends from an arts club in Kochi leave on a trip to Kodaikanal in the neighbouring state of Tamil Nadu, during the Onam vacation. Upon reaching a point, a few friends decide to etch down their group name ‘Manjummel Boys’ on the rocks within the cave. The police arrange for more rope and reel Kuttan down further. They mention that the British had called Guna Caves as The Devil's Kitchen due to this reason and that the particular hole is over 900 feet deep. They explore Kodaikanal and before leaving, one of the friends, Sudhi tells them about Guna Caves, a place where the film Gunaa was shot. They estimate that Subhash has fallen down into a depth of around 120 feet. The police officers are initially reluctant, but finally agree after being convinced by the friends and the locals. At 120 feet, Kuttan is able to see Subhash barely lying on a ledge covered in blood and muddy water due to the rain. Inebriated, high and happy, the friends reach Guna Caves and decide to explore the restricted areas of the caves by themselves despite a warning from Dominic, a tourist guide. However, Kuttan states that he can hear Subhash's voice clearly and that he cannot leave him down there. They decide not to tell anyone about the incident and tells Subhash's family that he fell in a waterfall. They inform the locals of what happened and ask them for help, and they all suggest going to the police station and forest guard. But soon one of the boys, Sixen hears Subhash's cries and informs others that he is alive and the police are also convinced to try and save him. Initially everyone assumes he is pulling a prank, but as he does not respond even after calling out to him multiple times, they all start to panic. Though there are signs of a lurking danger, the friends explore further. Subhash suffers trauma from the fall and is not able to sleep initially, but slowly starts recovering after going to trauma therapy. The police officer, after inspecting the hole, suggests that they leave Subhash as he probably is no longer alive, but the friends are adamant about rescuing him. Meanwhile, rain starts to flood the hole. Scared even more, the friends reach the local police station, where they are beaten; the police file an FIR against them for entering a restricted area. Kuttan is lowered into the hole, but along the way, the rope with which Kuttan is lowered runs out, and police are worried that it is unsafe to go any lower as there might be low oxygen levels, and they are not willing to risk Kuttan’s life as well. The fire department and more police officers are also called into the scene. 2 years later Kuttan is awarded the Jeevan Raksha Padak for his actions. The locals also inform them that the specific area was off-limits to people for a reason and that so far 13 people have fallen into that hole and none were ever recovered, dead or alive.
ground_truth: In 2006, a group of 10 friends from an arts club in Kochi leave on a trip to Kodaikanal in the neighbouring state of Tamil Nadu, during the Onam vacation. They explore Kodaikanal and before leaving, one of the friends, Sudhi tells them about Guna Caves, a place where the film Gunaa was shot. Inebriated, high and happy, the friends reach Guna Caves and decide to explore the restricted areas of the caves by themselves despite a warning from Dominic, a tourist guide. Though there are signs of a lurking danger, the friends explore further. Upon reaching a point, a few friends decide to etch down their group name ‘Manjummel Boys’ on the rocks within the cave. After etching it on the wall, the friends call out to show the remaining guys who are exploring on the other sides to take a picture and they all regroup. Subhash, one of the friends, falls into a covered hole in the ground while moving towards them. Initially everyone assumes he is pulling a prank, but as he does not respond even after calling out to him multiple times, they all start to panic. After the initial shock, a few of them run back to get help and others stay and continue calling out to him in hopes that he would respond. They inform the locals of what happened and ask them for help, and they all suggest going to the police station and forest guard. The locals also inform them that the specific area was off-limits to people for a reason and that so far 13 people have fallen into that hole and none were ever recovered, dead or alive. They mention that the British had called Guna Caves as The Devil's Kitchen due to this reason and that the particular hole is over 900 feet deep. Scared even more, the friends reach the local police station, where they are beaten; the police file an FIR against them for entering a restricted area. They are also accused of murdering Subhash and giving false complaints and no help is offered. Meanwhile, rain starts to flood the hole. Finally after being convinced, and fearing backlash from the local people for failing to help, one of the police officers agrees to go with them to the cave. On the way, he informs them that the last person who fell into the hole was the former Central Minister's nephew around ten years ago and all the forces had gotten together to rescue him, but no one had been able to. The police officer, after inspecting the hole, suggests that they leave Subhash as he probably is no longer alive, but the friends are adamant about rescuing him. But soon one of the boys, Sixen hears Subhash's cries and informs others that he is alive and the police are also convinced to try and save him. The fire department and more police officers are also called into the scene.They estimate that Subhash has fallen down into a depth of around 120 feet. They try lowering the rope, for Subhash to hold, but are sceptical that he may not be in a situation to hold on to the rope after a deep fall. They are scared to go inside the hole to retrieve him. Seeing this, one of the friends, Siju David, decides to go down. The police officers are initially reluctant, but finally agree after being convinced by the friends and the locals. Kuttan is lowered into the hole, but along the way, the rope with which Kuttan is lowered runs out, and police are worried that it is unsafe to go any lower as there might be low oxygen levels, and they are not willing to risk Kuttan’s life as well. However, Kuttan states that he can hear Subhash's voice clearly and that he cannot leave him down there. The police arrange for more rope and reel Kuttan down further. At 120 feet, Kuttan is able to see Subhash barely lying on a ledge covered in blood and muddy water due to the rain. Kuttan is able to retrieve him and the rest of the friends pull them up together successfully. After receiving first aid from the nearest clinic, they take Subhash to the hospital in their hometown, where he is treated more thoroughly. They decide not to tell anyone about the incident and tells Subhash's family that he fell in a waterfall. Subhash suffers trauma from the fall and is not able to sleep initially, but slowly starts recovering after going to trauma therapy. Later, the news that Kuttan saved Subhash comes out from a person who went to Tamil Nadu and Kuttan is applauded for his bravery. 2 years later Kuttan is awarded the Jeevan Raksha Padak for his actions.

openai/o3-mini-2025-01-31: <PLOT_SUMMARY>In 2006, a group of 10 friends from an arts club in Kochi leave on a trip to Kodaikanal in the neighbouring state of Tamil Nadu, during the Onam vacation. They explore Kodaikanal and before leaving, one of the friends, Sudhi, tells them about Guna Caves, a place where the film Gunaa was shot. Inebriated, high and happy, the friends reach Guna Caves and decide to explore the restricted areas of the caves by themselves despite a warning from Dominic, a tourist guide. Though there are signs of a lurking danger, the friends explore further. Upon reaching a point, a few friends decide to etch down their group name “Manjummel Boys” on the rocks within the cave. After etching it on the wall, the friends call out to show the remaining guys who are exploring on the other sides so that they can take a picture, and they all regroup. Suddenly, Subhash, one of the friends, falls into a covered hole in the ground while moving towards them. After the initial shock, a few of them run back to get help and others stay behind, calling out in hopes that he would respond. Initially, everyone assumes he is pulling a prank, but as he does not respond even after being called multiple times, they all start to panic. But soon one of the boys, Sixen, hears Subhash’s cries and informs the others that he is alive. Seeing this, one of the friends, Siju David, decides to go down. However, Kuttan interjects by stating that he can hear Subhash’s voice clearly and that he cannot leave him down there. The friends estimate that Subhash has fallen down into a depth of around 120 feet. They are scared to go inside the hole to retrieve him, so they try lowering a rope for Subhash to hold, though they are skeptical that after such a deep fall he would be able to grip it. Realizing they need more help, they inform the locals of what happened and ask for assistance; the locals suggest that they go to the police station and consult with the forest guards. Scared even more, the friends then reach the local police station, where they are beaten and an FIR is filed against them for entering a restricted area. Despite this, the police officers are initially reluctant but finally agree to help after being convinced by the friends and the locals. Finally, fearing backlash from the local people for failing to help, one of the police officers agrees to accompany them to the cave. On the way, he informs them that the last person to fall into that hole was the former Central Minister’s nephew about ten years ago—and although all available forces had once gathered to rescue him, no one had ever been recovered. As they continue, the group is told that the British once dubbed Guna Caves “The Devil’s Kitchen” because the specific hole is over 900 feet deep. The police then arrange for more rope and begin reeling Kuttan down further into the hole. However, as Kuttan is lowered, the rope runs out; the police worry that with the low oxygen levels further down it is unsafe to continue risking another life. Meanwhile, rain starts to flood the hole. At 120 feet, Kuttan is finally able to see Subhash barely lying on a ledge, covered in blood and muddy water from the rain. Mustering all his courage, Kuttan retrieves Subhash, and the rest of the friends work together to pull them both up successfully. After receiving first aid from the nearest clinic, they take Subhash to the hospital in their hometown where he is treated more thoroughly. Though initially he suffers trauma from the fall and cannot sleep, Subhash slowly begins to recover after undergoing trauma therapy. Fearing unwanted consequences and repercussions, the friends decide not to tell anyone about the true incident and instead fabricate a story, telling Subhash’s family that he fell in a waterfall. Later on, news spreads of how Kuttan saved Subhash—this account coming from someone who had recently been to Tamil Nadu—and Kuttan is applauded for his bravery. Two years later, Kuttan is awarded the Jeevan Raksha Padak for his heroic actions. In the meantime, however, matters take an unexpected turn as the friends are accused of murdering Subhash and filing false complaints, leaving them without any help from the authorities. The locals further warn them that the area is off-limits for a reason—revealing that, so far, 13 people have fallen into that hole and none have ever been recovered, dead or alive.

The following plot summary of a movie has had the sentences randomly reordered. Rewrite the plot summary with the sentences correctly ordered. Begin the plot summary with <PLOT_SUMMARY>.

The sentences are:

Alone in the desert, Najeeb eventually reaches civilization with the help of a passing Arab, and finds a local Malayali restaurant owned by Kunjikka, who nurses him back to health. They seize an opportunity during the Khafeel's daughter's wedding, fleeing into the desert. He faces imprisonment due to his own documentation issues where he meets the Khafeel, who leaves him as he is not his official sponsor and cannot take him back. Despite this setback, Najeeb eventually returns home. Their journey turns perilous as they struggle to find sustenance and direction, resulting in Hakim's death and Najeeb's near demise. In Saudi Arabia, Najeeb Muhammed and Hakim, two Malayali immigrants, arrive seeking a better life with visas arranged by their acquaintance Sreekumar. However, Najeeb's troubles are far from over. Eventually, Khadiri also disappears. Following a long journey, they are separated, with Najeeb left to work in a remote desert goat herd. Enduring harsh conditions and isolation, Najeeb witnesses the demise of a fellow goatherd, realizing the peril of his own situation. Stranded at the airport without knowing their employer, they are approached by a local Arab who mistakenly assumes he is their boss. After years of suffering, he is reunited with Hakim, who introduces him to Ibrahim Khadiri, a Somalian goatherd with knowledge of escape routes.

question:
The following plot summary of a movie has had the sentences randomly reordered. Rewrite the plot summary with the sentences correctly ordered. Begin the plot summary with <PLOT_SUMMARY>.

The sentences are:

Geeta Sethi, Jasmine Kohli, and Divya Rana are flight attendants with Kohinoor Airlines in Mumbai, which is on the verge of bankruptcy. Mittal also returns to Sudha, along with some of the gold he had stashed for himself. Divya is trained to be a pilot but is forced to take up the job of a flight attendant due to a lack of openings and keeps this hidden from her family as well as struggling to repay her education loan. They spike the drinks of the passengers with sleeping pills and land the plane at Divya's native town, Nanheri, where the police and custom officials are already waiting for them. They, however, manage to keep some gold for themselves and distribute it amongst their friends, colleagues, and loved ones. Initially, they had thought that their colleague, Komal, would have tipped the customs officer, however, after an emotional outburst by Komal, they realize that she nor their other colleagues tipped the customs. She does not believe in relationships, is fond of expensive things, and flaunts a fake and flashy lifestyle on social media. Geetu realizes that Mittal's wife, Sudha, was also an air hostess and Mala had referred that the tip came from an ex-air hostess; she was the only person who knew about the gold smuggling. Jasmine gets back Nanu’s gold ring from the pawn shop and splurges on herself. Manoj Mittal, the HR Head of Kohinoor Airlines, is the kingpin of the operation. Geeta's husband, Arun, runs a struggling food business from home. The enraged customs official, SI Mala, mentions that her tip is accurate which she received from an air hostess within Kohinoor, and cannot come to terms with the fact that she could not recover any gold. The three of them become part of the gold smuggling operation and their financial situation soon improves: Geeta funds Arun’s food business, along with helping Punnu and Sapna. She has to financially support her unemployed brother, Punnu, and his wife, Sapna, as well. They confront her and she reveals that Mittal is cheating on her and to exact revenge, she tipped the customs so that their arrest would also lead to Mittal's arrest. Vijay Walia, the Chairman of Kohinoor, and Mittal abscond and flee the country as the news comes out. Meanwhile, the other employees of the airline are still trying to make ends meet. Jasmine was raised by her maternal grandfather after her parents divorced. Divya repays her education loan fully. From Sudha, they get the address of Mittal in Al Burj and they tail him and eventually find Walia at a luxury hotel where his daughter is getting married. Someone tips off the customs officials that the three flight attendants are smuggling gold; and even though the three of them hide the stash, the detention that follows makes them feel humiliated and rethink their choice. The death of senior flight attendant Rajvanshi, while on duty, leads Geeta, Jasmine and Divya towards a clandestine operation to smuggle gold out of India to the Middle Eastern country, Al Burj. However, she further reveals that the real kingpin is actually Walia, who had stolen the airline's money, converted it into gold, and stashed it in Al Burj. Geeta manages to secure a job in the hotel as a housekeeper and get information about the gold. After a lot of hard work, they hatch a plan where they come to know that Walia and his family are taking the gold in a private jet to the Cayman Islands. The staff have not been paid their salaries in months, and the three friends, like all the other employees, keep hoping that things will change. Geeta and Jasmine manage to get the role of air hostess of the jet, while Divya becomes the pilot. The plane in which the three had hidden the stash is exposed one day when turbulence causes damage to the fuselage and the gold falls out.

openai/o3-mini-2025-01-31:
<PLOT_SUMMARY>Geeta Sethi, Jasmine Kohli, and Divya Rana are flight attendants with Kohinoor Airlines in Mumbai, which is on the verge of bankruptcy. Divya is trained to be a pilot but is forced to take up the job of a flight attendant due to a lack of openings, a secret she keeps from her family while struggling to repay her education loan. Jasmine, who was raised by her maternal grandfather after her parents divorced, along with Geeta—whose husband, Arun, runs a struggling food business from home—work in an environment where the staff have not been paid their salaries in months, leaving everyone hoping for a change.

The turning point comes with the death of senior flight attendant Rajvanshi while on duty, which drives Geeta, Jasmine, and Divya to embark on a clandestine operation to smuggle gold out of India to the Middle Eastern country of Al Burj. They soon discover that Manoj Mittal, the HR Head of Kohinoor Airlines, is the kingpin behind the operation. Determined to get to the bottom of the scheme, Geeta manages to secure a job in a hotel as a housekeeper in order to gather information about the gold. After much hard work, the trio hatches a plan and learns that Vijay Walia and his family are ferrying the stolen gold on a private jet bound for the Cayman Islands. To execute their plan, Geeta and Jasmine obtain roles as flight attendants on the jet while Divya, putting her pilot training to use, takes over as its pilot.

During the flight, they spike the drinks of the passengers with sleeping pills and deliberately land the plane at Divya’s native town, Nanheri—where the police and customs officials are already waiting. In the ensuing chaos, they manage to keep some of the gold for themselves and distribute portions among their friends, colleagues, and loved ones. However, turbulence later damages the plane’s fuselage and exposes the hidden stash of gold. Soon after, someone tips off the customs officials that the three flight attendants are involved in smuggling; although they manage to hide the bulk of the gold, their subsequent detention leaves them deeply humiliated and questioning their choices.

Initially, the women had assumed that their colleague, Komal, would have tipped off the customs officer. However, following an emotional outburst by Komal, they come to realize that neither she nor any of their other colleagues was responsible for the tip. (Komal, known for not believing in relationships, her fondness for expensive things, and a penchant for flaunting a flashy, albeit fake, lifestyle on social media, remains a peripheral figure in the unfolding events.) Soon, Geeta discovers that Mittal’s wife, Sudha—who had once been an air hostess—is connected to the tip, as SI Mala had informed them that the tip was provided by an ex-air hostess from Kohinoor. When confronted, Sudha reveals that Mittal has been cheating on her; in a bid for revenge, she had deliberately tipped off the authorities so that his arrest would follow. The enraged customs official, SI Mala, confirms that her tip, which she received from within the airline, was accurate and laments that she could not recover any of the gold. In the aftermath, Mittal returns to Sudha along with some of the gold he had secretly stashed for himself, while she further exposes that the true kingpin is Vijay Walia—the very man who had stolen the airline’s money, converted it into gold, and hidden it in Al Burj. As the news breaks out, Walia along with Mittal abscond and flee the country.

In the end, Divya manages to repay her education loan in full, and Jasmine retrieves Nanu’s gold ring from a pawn shop, splurging on herself with her newfound wealth. The three friends ultimately become an integral part of the gold smuggling operation, with their improved financial fortunes enabling Geeta to fund Arun’s food business and support her unemployed brother, Punnu, and his wife, Sapna. Meanwhile, the rest of the airline’s employees continue to struggle, clinging to hope for a better future.
